item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, December 14, 2024 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. macOS 15.2 breaks the ability to copy the OS to another drive (279 points | 155 comments)
2. Sharing new research, models, and datasets from Meta FAIR (226 points | 37 comments)
3. Luon programming language (119 points | 45 comments)
4. Ilya Sutskever Test of Time Talk "Pre-training as we know it will end" (81 points | 23 comments)
5. Show HN: Performant intracontinental public transport routing in Rust (63 points | 8 comments)
6. Energy-Harvesting Electronic Holiday Card 2024 (53 points | 5 comments)
7. Graphene Interconnects Aim to Give Moore's Law New Life (17 points | 3 comments)
8. Exotic new superconductors delight and confound (182 points | 47 comments)
9. The Pentium FDIV bug, reverse-engineered (142 points | 29 comments)
10. My PhD advisor rewrote himself in bash (2010) (128 points | 46 comments)
11. Byte Latent Transformer: Patches Scale Better Than Tokens (3 points | discuss)
12. Htmx 2.0.4 Released (142 points | 58 comments)
13. McKinsey and Company to pay $650M for role in opioid crisis (250 points | 136 comments)
14. Making my first robot as a software engineer (250 points | 29 comments)

16. Idiomatic Errors in Clojure (36 points | 6 comments)
17. Noninvasive imaging method can penetrate deeper into living tissue (163 points | 18 comments)
18. Show HN: Imposter Attack – Among Us-themed infrared game made with ESP32 (168 points | 25 comments)
19. Donald Bitzer has died (177 points | 19 comments)
20. Ask HN: What should I do with meet.hn? (180 points | 117 comments)
21. OpenAI whistleblower found dead in San Francisco apartment (566 points | 205 comments)
22. Is it possible to build a perfectly spherical prince Ruperts drop (2015) (34 points | 10 comments)
23. "All your base are belong to us" intro to my 2004 MIT Spam Conference talk (77 points | 25 comments)
24. Fermat's Last Theorem – how it’s going (388 points | 189 comments)
25. Web Origami, for making websites where you can understand how they’re made (183 points | 51 comments)
26. An Italian town that built its own sun (2021) (102 points | 34 comments)
27. Pompeii experts back Pliny's account of Mount Vesuvius eruption date (50 points | 18 comments)
28. Test (501 points | 120 comments)
29. MarkItDown: Python tool for converting files and office documents to Markdown (258 points | 62 comments)
30. Elon Musk wanted an OpenAI for-profit (480 points | 490 comments)
